Complete Guide

Investment Banking Resume

Your resume gets 30 seconds. Learn the exact format, bullet point structure, and positioning that gets interviews at top banks.

Get Professional Resume HelpSee Bullet Formula

Bankers review hundreds of resumes. They're looking for reasons to reject you, not reasons to interview you.

The Non-Negotiable Format Rules

Investment banking resumes follow a strict format. Deviate from this and you signal that you don't understand the industry.

One page only

No exceptions. Even with 10 years of experience, keep it to one page.

Times New Roman or Garamond

Conservative fonts only. No Arial, Calibri, or creative fonts.

10-11pt font size

Small enough to fit content, large enough to read easily.

0.5-0.75" margins

Don't go smaller than 0.5" or it looks cramped.

Consistent date formatting

Pick 'Jan 2024' or 'January 2024' and stick with it.

No color, no photos

Black text on white paper. That's it.

The Bullet Point Formula

[Action Verb] + [What You Did] + [Quantified Result/Context]

Weak Bullets

  • •Responsible for financial analysis
  • •Helped with pitch books
  • •Assisted team with various projects
  • •Worked on M&A transactions

Strong Bullets

  • •Built 3-statement financial model for $50M revenue SaaS company, identifying 15% EBITDA margin improvement opportunity
  • •Created 25-page management presentation for Series B fundraise, directly contributing to successful $30M raise
  • •Screened 50+ potential acquisition targets in healthcare sector, recommending 3 for further due diligence
  • •Analyzed trading comparables for 12 public companies, supporting $200M sell-side M&A engagement

Notice the difference? Strong bullets have specific numbers, clear actions, and business context. Weak bullets describe responsibilities without showing impact.

Resume Section Breakdown

Education

Top of resume for students/recent grads

✓ Include

  • •School name, degree, graduation date
  • •GPA if 3.5+ (bold it)
  • •Relevant coursework
  • •SAT/ACT if strong (1500+/34+)

✕ Avoid

  • •High school (unless prestigious)
  • •GPA below 3.0
  • •Irrelevant coursework

Experience

Main body of resume

✓ Include

  • •Company, title, dates, location
  • •3-5 bullet points per role
  • •Quantified achievements
  • •Action verbs (Analyzed, Built, Led)

✕ Avoid

  • •'Responsible for' or 'Helped with'
  • •Paragraphs instead of bullets
  • •Generic descriptions

Skills & Interests

Bottom of resume

✓ Include

  • •Technical skills (Excel, Bloomberg, SQL)
  • •Languages if fluent
  • •Specific, interesting hobbies
  • •Things you can discuss for 5 minutes

✕ Avoid

  • •'Microsoft Office proficient'
  • •Generic interests like 'Travel'
  • •Anything you can't talk about

9 Resume Mistakes That Get You Dinged

Any one of these can get your resume rejected instantly.

1Typos or grammatical errors — instant rejection
2Inconsistent formatting (dates, fonts, spacing)
3Listing responsibilities instead of achievements
4No quantification (numbers, percentages, dollar amounts)
5Including a photo (never do this in US finance)
6Objective statement or summary (waste of space)
7More than one page
8Unexplained gaps in timeline
9Lying or exaggerating (you WILL be caught)
